html.h2: Upgrading from Prior Versions of the Cisco Security Suite
html.p: Welcome to the new version of the Cisco Security Suite. As part of this upgrade, we have completely re-designed the app from the ground up to incorporate the latest thinking in Common Information Model, Technology Add-ons and Data Models.

ul.li: You must remove all prior versions of the Splunk Cisco Security Suite, including Splunk_CiscoFirewalls, Splunk_CiscoIronportWSA, Splunk_CiscoIronportESA and Splunk_CiscoIPS before installing this app.
Update the Technology Add-ons, per the Getting Started instructions.

html.p: The standard source types have changed for most of the Cisco inputs to conform to the standard naming scheme. For example, cisco_asa has become cisco:asa. You can either alter the Technology Add-on to use the old name, or you can alter the Supporting Add-on eventtypes to search for both types.

For Web Security, we have added additional fields to the standard logging configuration so that more data is collected and reported on, making bandwidth reports and browser reports possible. As a result, you should not use older data for Web Security reporting.
Please use Splunk Answers if you run into problems. Ensure you note that you are using the Cisco Security Suite v3 on Splunk Enterprise 6.
